intro: Hieracium retyezatense subsp. radikifaucis, commonly known as the Radicifaucis hawkweed, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellowish to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous areas. Its subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and leaf structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
